name: Dietary Orders, Supplements, and Preferences
description: The ODS segment contains information about dietary orders, nutritional supplements, and food preferences for patients. This segment is essential for clinical nutrition management, meal planning, dietary restrictions, and nutritional therapy in healthcare settings. It supports both routine dietary orders and specialized therapeutic nutrition requirements.

cardinality.note: Multiple ODS segments can be used to specify different dietary orders or supplements

ODS.1.name: Type
ODS.1.description: This field indicates the type of dietary order or service being requested. It distinguishes between diet orders, supplement orders, and nutritional assessments.
ODS.1.generationHint: D for diet orders (70%), S for supplements (20%), P for preferences (10%)

ODS.2.name: Service Period
ODS.2.description: This field contains the time period during which the dietary service is to be provided. This can specify meal times, duration of therapy, or ongoing services.
ODS.2.generationHint: Common meal periods: BF, LU, DN for regular meals

ODS.3.name: Diet, Supplement, or Preference Code
ODS.3.description: This field contains the specific code for the dietary order, supplement, or preference being requested.

ODS.4.name: Text Instruction
ODS.4.description: This field contains free-text instructions or additional details about the dietary order that cannot be conveyed through coded fields.
ODS.4.generationHint: Free text for special instructions: 'No salt added', 'Extra fluids', 'Small frequent meals'

ODS.5.name: Description
ODS.5.description: This field provides a detailed description of the dietary order, supplement, or preference to assist with meal planning and nutrition management.
ODS.5.generationHint: Descriptive text explaining the diet or supplement requirements

ODS.6.name: Service Start Date/Time
ODS.6.description: This field contains the date and time when the dietary service should begin.
ODS.6.generationHint: Start date/time for diet order - often immediate or next meal

ODS.7.name: Service End Date/Time
ODS.7.description: This field contains the date and time when the dietary service should end or be discontinued.
ODS.7.generationHint: End date/time for temporary diet orders or supplements

ODS.8.name: Diet Supplement Ordering Provider
ODS.8.description: This field identifies the healthcare provider who ordered the dietary service or supplement.
ODS.8.generationHint: Physician, dietitian, or nutritionist ordering the diet

ODS.9.name: Diet Supplement Verification Provider
ODS.9.description: This field identifies the healthcare provider who verified or approved the dietary order.
ODS.9.generationHint: Registered dietitian or physician verifying nutrition order

ODS.10.name: Ordering Date/Time
ODS.10.description: This field contains the date and time when the dietary order was placed.
ODS.10.generationHint: Timestamp when the diet order was entered into the system

ODS.11.name: Order Effective Date/Time
ODS.11.description: This field contains the date and time when the dietary order becomes effective.
ODS.11.generationHint: When the diet order should take effect - may differ from ordering time

ODS.12.name: Order Expiration Date/Time
ODS.12.description: This field contains the date and time when the dietary order expires if not renewed.
ODS.12.generationHint: Automatic expiration time for temporary diet orders

ODS.13.name: Order Control Code Reason
ODS.13.description: This field provides the reason for the dietary order control action (new, cancel, discontinue, etc.).
ODS.13.generationHint: Reason for diet order or change: medical condition, allergy, preference

notes: ODS segments are essential for comprehensive nutritional care management
Type field (ODS.1) and Diet/Supplement Code (ODS.3) are required
Service periods help coordinate meal delivery with nursing and food service
Text instructions provide flexibility for special dietary requirements
Provider identification ensures accountability for nutritional orders
Date/time fields support complex timing requirements for therapeutic diets

dataConsistency.timingValidation: Service start time (ODS.6) should be before end time (ODS.7)
dataConsistency.orderingValidation: Order effective time (ODS.11) should be after ordering time (ODS.10)
dataConsistency.typeConsistency: Supplement codes should align with type S, diet codes with type D
dataConsistency.providerValidation: Ordering provider should have appropriate credentials for nutrition orders

businessRules.allergyChecking: Diet orders should be cross-checked against patient allergies
businessRules.therapeuticValidation: Therapeutic diets require appropriate medical justification
businessRules.continuityRules: New diet orders should cancel or modify existing conflicting orders
businessRules.timingRules: NPO orders should have appropriate timing relative to procedures
businessRules.providerRequirements: Complex nutritional therapies may require dietitian approval

messageFlow.workflow: Usually accompanies ORC segment and follows standard order management patterns
